references.reason: This paper introduces the fundamental concept of Label Distribution Learning (LDL), which is the central theme of the current research.

references.paper_title: Label distribution learning by exploiting label correlations
references.reason: This paper is important as it advances LDL by incorporating label correlations, addressing a limitation of earlier LDL methods and directly relevant to the current work.

references.paper_title: Label distribution learning with label correlations via low-rank approximation
references.reason: This study further improves LDL by using low-rank approximation to capture label correlations more effectively, a technique that may inspire the current work.

references.paper_title: Label distribution learning with label-specific features
references.reason: This paper explores another crucial aspect of LDL by focusing on label-specific features, enhancing the model's ability to capture nuances in label distributions, relevant to heterogeneous data.
This work addresses the challenge of generalizability in LDL, which is highly relevant to the current research on extending LDL to heterogeneous graph data.
